page.title: 03CLUBS IN WENHAM AND RAYDON
page.content: Many over sixties in Wenham are members of the Forgetmenot Club which meets every Wednesday afternoon in Capel St.Mary village hall.Most members play Whist for about an hour and then have tea and biscuits for half an hour when they chat and exchange news with friends.They then play a game of Bingo. Members often take homegrown fruit, flowers and plants to be sold to other members,the proceeds going towards funds to pay for outings to the seaside or places of interest.Funds are also raised by a Christmas Fair and coffee mornings. Some ladies in Wenham and Raydon belong to the Women's Institute.Although neither has it's own Institute there is one at Holton and one at Capel St.Mary. This is a national organisation comprising 9192 institutes with links worldwide through A.C.W.W.
